description.narrative:
'CED put forward the Initiative #Promoting the initial legal support and implementing regulations on medical examination and treatment for people with hearing loss# to promote the accessibility of the departments, rooms and services in hospitals for persons with hearing disabilities. The project will focus on several activities as presented:
(1) Raising community awareness about legal policies related to the rights of people with hearing loss and how to implement policies of medical examination and treatment.
(2) Training #Skills in supporting people with hearing loss in hospitals# for health officers (nurses, technicians), community health students, social workers, etc. and Training Vietnamese sign language interpreters.
(3) Making a survey amongst 20 hospitals and 200 people with hearing loss on the implementation of support policies for people with hearing loss with regard to accessing the public health services, and on the current status of the Hearing Impaired #s understanding of the rightsand needs of support in medical examination and treatment. On this basis, CED will have suggestions for better policy implementation that helps policies work to the best interests with hearing loss.;
(4) Providing the initial legal support for people with hearing loss by lawyers from the law offices or the legal support centers.
(5) Contributions and suggestions to Governmental Agencies: The result of the research will be shared at policy communication workshops and with media to send a message to the Ministry of Health and relevant agencies. The project will also produce documents (publications, video clips) to share with the community so that other localities can refer and use such as:
- A guiding handbook on skills to support people with hearing loss for medical examination and treatment. - Case studies about legal advice and support.
